source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_027_chunk4
evidence_span: Zircaloy-4 is a zirconium-base alloy containing $1 . 5 \%$ tin. $0 . 2 \%$ iron. $0 . 1 \%$ chromium, and $0 . 1 \%$ oxygen.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_027_chunk4
evidence_span: The tin and the oxygen are in solid solution, whereas the majority of the iron and chromium segregate together in precipitates of the type $Z \mathrm { r } ( \mathrm { F e } , \mathrm { C r } ) _ { \ b { \imath } _ { 0 } } [ l ]$ .

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_027_chunk4
evidence_span: The experimental data agree well with a second order kinetic law.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_027_chunk4
evidence_span: The precipitate volume grows as a linear function of time.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_027_chunk4
evidence_span: No systematic influence of a (iron $^+$ chromium) content on the modal particle size has been found in alloys up to $1 5 ~ 0 0 0$ ppm (iron $^+$ chromium).
